sense.name: an order for payment from a bank
sense.examples: Sally cashed her check at the bank. They told me the checks for the rent is in the mail. He sent us a cashier's check for $500.

sense.name: an assessment or verification of a circumstance
sense.examples: The pilot and copilot have completed their pre-flight checks. John does a regular check of the oil level in his car engine. I had Betty run through the numbers as an additional check on my calculations.

sense.name: restaurant bill or tab
sense.examples: We split the check for dinner three ways. John usually picks up the check for our department lunches. How much did the check come to, without the bar bill?

sense.name: a physical stoppage or halting of progress or activity
sense.commentary: CHECK[+event][+physical][+stoppage][+of_activity] Note: implies a halting of an otherwise ongoing activity
sense.examples: Without treatment, there will be no check on the disease's progression to terminal illness. The umpire declared the batter's swing was a check, so it didn't count. (not a complete swing) The river put a check to the bloodhounds' tracking of the prisoner's scent.

sense.name: a symbol that is a mark or tick
sense.examples: I put a check by the names of students who had volunteered to work on the project. Indicate your three top color preferences by placing checks next to the color names.

sense.name: a regulatory principle or rule of constraint
sense.examples: His book is an appeal to a permanent check on the growth and abuses of centralized authority. The constitution defines a system of checks and balances for the central government.

sense.name: a textile pattern, design
sense.examples: The woolen fabric was a black-and-white check. Mary dislikes checks or stripes in upholstery material.

sense.name: an obstructive play in hockey
sense.examples: His check of the offense was brilliant. The umpire said it was an illegal check.

sense.name: a direct attack on the king, in chess
sense.examples: The computer program put three checks on my king before the final checkmate. That move is illegal because it will put your king in check.

sense.name: component of a piano that stops a hammer from retouching the strings
sense.examples: The checks on this old piano may need cleaning and repair.

sense.name: a tag claim for personal property
sense.examples: Mary showed her baggage checks to the airport attendant to reclaim her luggage. Fancy restaurants usually offer coat and hat checks.

sense.name: an equalizing bet in a poker game
sense.examples: John made a check of the betting, but did not raise it any. With everyone's check on the betting, it was time to show cards.

sense.name: a flaw or crack in timer
sense.examples: This lumber has too many checks in it to be top grade.
